instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PM_DSW_PWRGD: What is PM_DSW_PWRGD? The "PM_DSW_PWRGD" signal in a MacBook stands for "Deep Sleep Well Power Good‚Äù and is required for the machine to power on & post..
definitions.PM_RSMRST_L: What is PM_RSMRST_L? The "PM_RSMRST_L" signal, also known as "Resume Reset," is an active-low signal that is part of the power management system in MacBooks. It asserts a reset signal when it is low voltage which is what the _L is for. Is the machine is in a reset stage it will not properly power on..
definitions.PCH_DSWVRMEN:
What is PCH_DSWVRMEN? DSWVRMEN stands for DeepSx Well On-Die Voltage Regulator Enable. This signal enables the internal DSW 1.05 V regulators and must be always pulled-up to PPVRTC_G3H 3.3 volts.
If this signal is not being asserted (i.e., not enabled), the on-die voltage regulators responsible for supplying power in deep sleep states may not be active. This could lead to the MacBook failing to exit from a deep sleep state or having issues when trying to enter one, contributing to a scenario where the device does not power on.

If the signal is not present or not at the correct levels, it could indicate a problem with the Platform Controller Hub (PCH) itself..
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..

threads.title: Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not work from adapter and works on battery
threads.message:
when AC adapter connected fan not spain and charging led turns to red without attaching battery , when battery is attached charging led go to green and macbook works ,when i remove battery mac still working , in other hand macbook boot up and ssd not recognized and cpu temperature is so high.
 video describe the situation 

video note: customer said that macbook falled down .

[URL='https://drive.google.com/file/d/12Hcl1bebN8jUAR8FgbUO1G3rd00fKLnT/view?usp=sharing']video her google drive[/URL]

threads.title: Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not work from adapter and works on battery
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Don't play again connecting disconnecting battery, when charger is plugged in.
You risk to fry the SMC; do NOT force your luck.

If Magsafe light switch to green, when battery is connected, can mean fully charged battery, or a problem with charging battery circuit.

The board MUST turn on by itself, when charger is connected (without battery).
So do not connect battery again, until fix this.

Post exact ohm resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.
Also post <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> voltages; pins 1, 2, 3, 6, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 19, 20, 27.
Use surrounding components as test points.

threads.title: Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not work from adapter and works on battery
Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not work from adapter and works on battery
threads.message:
OK, so you get correct <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> on charger only.
Now check <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>/SUS, <SIGNAL>PM_RSMRST_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_DSW_PWRGD</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PCH_DSWVRMEN</SIGNAL>.

Do NOT quote an entire previous post, visible few centimeters above.
Instead of cliciking "Reply" button, write directly in the reply box.
Please, maintain forum aesthetic...

threads.title: Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not work from adapter and works on battery
threads.message:
ALL TESTS ON AC ADAPTER ONLY


<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>             ---  0.03

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>                      ---   3.33

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>                    ---  3.23

 <SIGNAL>PM_RSMRST_L</SIGNAL>              ---  3.30

 <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL>             ---  3.41
 
 <SIGNAL>PM_DSW_PWRGD</SIGNAL>        ---  3.41

 <SIGNAL>PCH_DSWVRMEN</SIGNAL>        ----  3.23

threads.title: Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not work from adapter and works on battery
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>             ---  0.03"
PCH cannot start power on sequence in this condition.
Are you using original Magsafe 2 charger?

Trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> and check for drop pulse at <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL>, at same time.
Try to start in SMC bypass mode also.

threads.title: Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not work from adapter and works on battery
threads.message:
Yes I use original charger and test other charger  but the same situation
When I trigger <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>   pulse of <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL>  drop from 3.41 to 0.34  but no boot up fan not spin

[COLOR=rgb(209, 72, 65)]IT STARTS NORMALLY FROM BATTERY BUT NOT DETECTS SSD. 
I APPLIED SMC RESET AND PRAM RESET BUT NOT BOOT FROM CHARGER[/COLOR]

threads.title: Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not work from adapter and works on battery
Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not work from adapter and works on battery
threads.message: I check it  10k ohm  and fin connected to surrounding components and the impedance between  <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> and ground is about  3M Ohm, also i check <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> transistor <TRANSISTOR>Q3000</TRANSISTOR> no problem.

threads.title: Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not work from adapter and works on battery
threads.message: Reball SMC; change it, if still low <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not work from adapter and works on battery
threads.message:
Also  <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>  control by pch may be cpu chip defective?
note: mac can boot from battery but ssd not be detected and temperature of cpu is very high and fan full speed spaining.

threads.title: Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not work from adapter and works on battery
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> is controlled by SMC; PCH uses it as input.
An internal problem of PCH can affect this line, but is less probably.

Fan starts at full speed, or increases speed as CPU gets hot?
SSD is not detected at all in Disk Utility?

threads.title: Macbook Air <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not work from adapter and works on battery
threads.message:
Fan starts normally and rapidly go to  full speed due to CPU gets hot.
I try more than SSD all not detected in Disk Utility and its works fine in other machine properly.

[COLOR=rgb(209, 72, 65)]REBALLING SMC THEN REFLASH BIOS[/COLOR] FIX THE PROBLEM

THANKS [B][USER=682]2informaticos[/USER][/B]
